column4: Is there a utility in ubuntu that will set up my networking for DHCP or whatever?
a way to set up my networking other than editing /etc/networking/interfaces
cuz that's not working :(
Erm I don't have the gui installed?
hrm :(
pastebin the /etc/network/interfaces you tried?
Like the server works I can see out and other people can SSH into it and all, but the DNS isn't working so if I want to like ping google.com or something it doesn't work.
Ok let me pastebin it.
what DNS server(s) are being assigned via DHCP?
Well I looked on the router settings and it had 205.171.3.65 in there.
What I'm trying to do is set up unbuntu so that it will get the DNS from DHCP and the IP will be static.
on the Ubuntu machine try "nslookup cnn.com 205.171.3.65" (no quotes)
that returns a bunch of stuff but it seems to me that it did what it should.
gave me a bunch of IP adresses for cnn
the best way to do that is to set a static IP associated with the MAC address of the card in the machine
Here is the file contents http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/289/
So why doesn't DNS work.  Did I not set up something right?
if nslookup works when being given the nameserver's IP, then the problem is with DHCP not setting it correctly
Yeah but I don't think the box is set up to use DHCP at all yet.
check the router's config
I mean the DHCP works for every other machine on the network, but I don't think the server is looking for DHCP at all or anything.
Ubuntu uses DHCP by default
When I was doing the install and it started to look for DHCP I hit cancel and entered all the info in manually.
